college_vision.vision_text: Achieving excellence and leadership regionally and globally in various specific fields, and raising competitive capabilities in light of digital transformation.
college_vision.mission_text: Preparing a creative and competitive graduate academically and professionally in terms of scientific and research aspects in postgraduate studies and research, and keeping pace with labor market requirements in light of Egypt's Vision 2030, achieving sustainable development for society.

college_goals.goal1: 1. Developing the college's academic programs in line with global quality standards and digital transformation policies.
college_goals.goal2: 2. Maximizing the competitive capabilities of college graduates and their ability to make decisions and deal with crises.
college_goals.goal3: 3. Promoting the college's distinguished departments regionally to attract students at the local and regional levels.
college_goals.goal4: 4. Doubling funded research projects to support scientific research.
college_goals.goal5: 5. Raising the efficiency of research output to increase international publication and support the labor market locally, regionally, and globally.

dean_word.title: Dean's Word

Prof. Dr. Nagda Ibrahim Madi

Dean of the Faculty of Specific Education, Alexandria University

history.title: Historical Overview
history.content:
The schools of the Ministry of Education suffered for many years from a clear shortage in applied subjects schools (Home Economics, Music Education, Art Education), where there was a minority of specialized colleges that provided the ministry with its needs in these specializations such as the College of Home Economics in Cairo and Fine Arts in Alexandria. However, most graduates in these colleges were heading to other fields away from the teaching profession, which was rare, in addition to the fact that teacher training institutes were primarily concerned with studying applied subjects, so educational subjects were added to students in the last two years of study, and thus the community lacked the educationally qualified teacher to teach these subjects.

Therefore, thinking was directed towards establishing specific colleges that work to qualify this teacher who can be relied upon in developing students' personalities through educational programs in arts, music and home economics, to perform this vital role with proper preparation.

The Specific Teacher Colleges in Alexandria was one of four colleges that were approved for establishment in September 1988 in Abbasiya for female teachers, and Dar Al-Salam for male teachers and two colleges in Alexandria at Raml Teachers, but the circumstances of establishment and the delay in study in the year of establishment led to the opening of one college in Alexandria. The name at first did not agree with the precise scientific content and the educational goal for which the college was established, then the college was named the Faculty of Specific Education in Alexandria to be one of the leading colleges that moved with steady and conscious steps to graduate the educationally qualified teacher technically in the fields of home economics, arts and music.

To keep pace with contemporary global educational trends in teacher preparation, the Supreme Council of Specific Colleges and Kindergartens adopted the introduction of the two-semester system that achieves continuity of the educational process and full integration of students in study and activities throughout the academic year. Based on this, this system was applied starting from the academic year 1995/1996 according to Ministerial Decision No. 1556 dated 26/10/1995, and the study plan was distributed on this basis in all academic divisions of the college.

notifications.title: Notifications
notifications.enabled_body: You will now receive important updates from the Faculty app.

about_app.title: About the App
about_app.description: Naw3ia is a modern Flutter application designed for the Faculty of Specific Education at Alexandria University...

features.0: AI Chat Assistant: Instantly get answers to your questions about the faculty, departments, courses, and student services using an integrated AI-powered chatbot.
features.1: Multi-language Support: The app supports both English and Arabic, making it accessible to a diverse user base.
features.2: Personalized Student Profile: View and manage your academic profile, including department, program, level, GPA, and personal information.
features.3: Academic Departments & Programs: Explore detailed information about all academic departments...
features.4: News & Announcements: Stay updated with the latest news, events, conferences, and important announcements.
features.5: Academic Calendar: Access a calendar of events, workshops, conferences, and key academic dates.
features.6: Notifications: Receive timely notifications about important deadlines, events, and faculty updates.
features.7: Onboarding Experience: New users are guided through an onboarding process.
features.8: Settings & Customization: Switch between light and dark themes. Change the app language. Manage notification preferences.
features.9: Secure Login & Logout: User authentication ensures that your data is secure.

about_app.purpose: The app aims to prepare and support students and staff in their academic journey...
